Build Meta Data Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2013-04-07  | Version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT
Overview
  • Introduction
  • Goals
  • Usage

Usage

Brief examples on how to use the Build Meta Data Plugin's goals.

Retrieve local host name

The local-hostname goal can be used to load current host name

<project>
  ...
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
        <artifactId>build-metadata-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>get-local-hostname</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>hostname</goal>
            </goals>
            <configuration>
              <!-- if not given, 'local.hostname' name is used -->
              <localHostNameProperty>my.local.hostname</localHostNameProperty>
            </configuration>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
  ...
</project>

Retrieve Operation System Information

The build-helper:os goal can be used to get information about the current operation system. 

<project>
  ...
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
        <artifactId>build-metadata-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>get-os-information</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>os</goal>
            </goals>
            <configuration>
              <!-- if not given, 'os' name is used as prefix -->
              <propertyPrefix>osinformation</propertyPrefix>
            </configuration>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
  ...
</project>

After the goal executes (by default during the validate phase) the following properties will be available.

osinformation.family
osinformation.name
osinformation.version
osinformation.arch

Retrieve Java Information

The build-helper:java goal can be used to get information about the current java runtime etc.

<project>
  ...
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
        <artifactId>build-metadata-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>get-java-information</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>java</goal>
            </goals>
            <configuration>
              <!-- if not given, 'build.environment' name is used as prefix -->
              <propertyPrefix>build.env</propertyPrefix>
            </configuration>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
  ...
</project>

After the goal executes (by default during the validate phase) the following properties will be available.

build.env.java.vendor
build.env.java.version

build.env.java.runtime.name
build.env.java.runtime.version

build.env.java.specification.name
build.env.java.specification.vendor
build.env.java.specification.version

build.env.java.vm.name
build.env.java.vm.info
build.env.java.vm.vendor
build.env.java.vm.version

build.env.java.vm.specification.name
build.env.java.vm.specification.vendor
build.env.java.vm.specification.version

build.env.sun.management.compiler

Retrieve Currently logged in user.

The username goal can be used to get the currently logged in user name.

<project>
  ...
  <build>
    <plugins>
      <plugin>
        <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
        <artifactId>build-metadata-maven-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
        <executions>
          <execution>
            <id>get-username</id>
            <goals>
              <goal>username</goal>
            </goals>
            <configuration>
              <!-- if not given, 'username' name is used -->
              <userNameProperty>my.username</userNameProperty>
            </configuration>
          </execution>
        </executions>
      </plugin>
    </plugins>
  </build>
  ...
</project>
